Package org.aeonbits.owner.util.bytesize

Enum ByteSizeUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ByteSizeUnit>
      • org.aeonbits.owner.util.bytesize.ByteSizeUnit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<ByteSizeUnit>

    public enum ByteSizeUnit
extends Enum<ByteSizeUnit>
    Specifies the available byte size units that a ByteSize can have. A byte size unit has a ByteSizeStandard that dictates the base value to be raised to a given power as well as the power value that dictates the magnitude of the unit. For example, a unit having the SI standard with a power value of 4 is known as a terabyte while a unit having the IEC standard with a power value of 4 is known as a tebibyte. The former has a factor of 1000^4 while the latter has a factor of 1024^4.
    Author:
    Stefan Freyr Stefansson

      • parse

        public static ByteSizeUnit parse​(String unit)
        Parses a string representation of a byte size unit and returns the corresponding ByteSizeUnit. There is support for various formats. Below is a list describing them where [prefix] represents the long form prefix of the unit (such as "kilo", "mega", "tera", etc) and [first] represents the first letter in the prefix (such as "k", "m", "t", etc):
        • "" (empty string) - refers to the BYTES
        • "b" - refers to the BYTES.
        • "[prefix]byte" - the prefix determines what ByteSizeStandard is being used.
        • "[prefix]bytes" - the prefix determines what ByteSizeStandard is being used.
        • "[first]" - refers to the ByteSizeStandard.IEC standard for the corresponding prefix, eg. "k" is equal to "kibibyte"
        • "[first]i" - refers to the ByteSizeStandard.IEC standard for the corresponding prefix, eg. "ki" is equal to "kibibyte"
        • "[first]ib" - refers to the ByteSizeStandard.IEC standard for the corresponding prefix, eg. "kib" is equal to "kibibyte"
        • "[first]b" - refers to the ByteSizeStandard.SI standard for the corresponding prefix, eg. "kb" is equal to "kilobyte"
        The parsing is case insensitive, meaning that the following strings are equivalent: "KiB", "kIb", "KIB", etc. This method will return null if the specified string is not a valid ByteSizeUnit string as described above.
        Parameters:
        unit - the string representation of the desired ByteSizeUnit.
        Returns:
        the ByteSizeUnit represented by the specified string or null if the string could not be translated into a known unit.

      • isSI

        public boolean isSI​()
        Returns whether this ByteSizeUnit is an SI unit.
        Returns:
        true iff this unit is an SI unit.

      • isIEC

        public boolean isIEC​()
        Returns whether this ByteSizeUnit is an IEC unit.
        Returns:
        true iff this unit is an IEC unit.

      • getFactor

        public BigDecimal getFactor​()
        Gets the multiplication factor for this ByteSizeUnit. Returns the result of raising the poweOf value of this units standard to the power specified in this unit.
        Returns:
        the factor by which to multiply for this unit.

      • toStringLongForm

        public String toStringLongForm​()
        Returns the long string representation of this unit, such as "kilobytes", "megabytes" or "bytes". Note that this method always returns the plural form.
        Returns:
        the plural long string representation of this unit.

      • toStringShortForm

        public String toStringShortForm​()
        Returns the short string representation of this unit, such as "KiB", "B" or "MB".
        Returns:
        the short string representation of this unit.
